urls.title: Climate: UK could face water shortages if action is not taken to conserve supplies
urls.description: The Environment Agency says we don't have enough infrastructure to store water from wetter winters for the drier summers.

text:
Good article with input from the @EnvAgency and @Ofwat. #Climatechange is having and will continue to have an increasing impact on water resources. A changing climate and increased precipitation intensity does not equal increased water availability. 

https://t.co/jIE3V9zZ7l

text: @MarkAvery @WWTconservation @RSPBEngland @RSPBScience @foodgov @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @pow_rebecca What is wrong with DEFRA? It is incontrovertible that lead is a poison. It was banned in angling decades ago. It's bad enough the shooting fraternity keep firing it at animals and birds. Criminally negligent DEFRA doesn't ban it being shot indiscriminately into the environment.
